data.Title: Google August 2024 Core Update Rolling Out
data.Description: Google has begun rolling out its August 2024 core update, which the company says will help surface useful content from small and independent sites. The rollout may take up to a month to complete.

data.Title: DOJ May Break Up Google
data.Description: The US Department of Justice is considering breaking up Google, potentially separating Android and Chrome, and possibly even Google Ads. Other scenarios include requiring Google to share data with competitors.

data.Title: Google AI Overviews Expand with New Features and Countries
data.Description: Google is expanding its AI-generated search summaries (AI Overviews) to six new countries: United Kingdom, India, Japan, Indonesia, Mexico, and Brazil. The company is also rolling out a new right-hand link display for AI Overviews on desktop and testing AI Overviews in incognito mode.

data.Title: Google Search Console Recommendations Rolling Out
data.Description: Google has started rolling out recommendations in Google Search Console. This feature aims to provide website owners with actionable insights to enhance their search performance.

data.Title: Bing Was Faster Than Google in 2017, Internal Documents Reveal
data.Description: During the DOJ antitrust trials, a 2017 Google internal document revealed that Bing Search outperformed Google in terms of speed, especially for mobile searches. This information sheds light on the competitive landscape of search engines at that time.

data.Title: Publishers' Q2 Earnings Look Positive Due to AI and Ad Market
data.Description: Publishers are reporting a strong second quarter in 2024, with AI deals and an improved ad market contributing to their positive bottom lines.

data.Title: Google Hotel Listings Targeted by Hijackers
data.Description: Google hotel listings are being targeted by hijackers who are adding fake WhatsApp numbers and marking hotels as permanently closed.

data.Title: Criteo in M&A Talks with Skai to Boost Retail Media Presence
data.Description: Criteo is in discussions to acquire Skai, formerly Kenshoo, for hundreds of millions of dollars. The move aims to strengthen Criteo's retail media capabilities with new measurement tools.

data.Title: Political Ad Spending Favors Connected TV
data.Description: As political ad spending increases, connected TV (CTV) is emerging as a major beneficiary. Publishers, media agencies, and ad tech vendors report a significant flow of political ad dollars towards CTV.
